title: One killed after teens take turns shooting each other wearing body armor
description: One teenager is dead after at least two teens took turns shooting at each other while wearing body armor, police in Belleview, Florida, said.

title: Mexican truck drivers block major US-Mexico point of entry
description: Commercial traffic at Pharr-Reynosa International Bridge -- a major port of entry for the US-Mexico border that handles both commercial and passenger vehicles -- is "halted temporarily" due to an ongoing protest on the Mexican side of the border and there are "no southbound movements by US carriers," a US Customs and Border Protection official confirmed to CNN Monday.

title: Russian TV covered strike in Ukraine very differently than evidence suggests
description: CNN's Brian Stelter looks at the ways Russian State TV is covering the brutal military invasion in Ukraine.

title: Inside a ravaged Ukrainian school that became a Russian base
description: Russian forces destroyed and looted a school and then made it their base. Ukrainians react to the devastation and describe the pain of losing their loved ones to CNN's Clarissa Ward.

title: Watch John Lennon's son cover 'Imagine' for Ukraine aid
description: Julian Lennon, son of the Beatles icon John Lennon, performs 'Imagine' publicly for the first time as part of Global Citizen's "Stand Up for Ukraine" social media rally.

title: Austria's leader says his face-to-face meeting with Putin was 'not a friendly visit'
description: Austria's Chancellor Karl Nehammer said he raised alleged Russian atrocities in Ukraine during a "tough" and unfriendly meeting Monday with Vladimir Putin -- the first Western sit-down with the Russian President since he launched his invasion in February.

title: Britney Spears says she is pregnant
description: Britney Spears has shared that she and partner Sam Asghari are expecting a baby.

title: Neptune just experienced an unexplained temperature shift
description: The most distant planet in our solar system has presented a new mystery.

title: Russian driver, 15, fired for allegedly making Nazi salute
description: Russian karting driver Artem Severiukhin, 15, has denied making a Nazi salute atop a podium on Sunday.

title: Scientists come up with a fresh take on an enduring moon mystery
description: The far side of the moon, which we can never see from our vantage point on Earth, looks surprisingly different than the orb we're used to seeing in the night sky.

title: Far-left candidate nearly edged out Le Pen
description: • How Marine Le Pen has changed since losing the 2017 presidential election

title: Pakistan's Parliament votes in opposition leader Shehbaz Sharif as Prime Minister
description: Pakistan's lawmakers voted in opposition leader Shehbaz Sharif as the country's new Prime Minister on Monday, after Imran Khan was ousted in a no-confidence vote over allegations of poor governance.

title: Ex-CIA Chief: In many ways, the Russians are on the run
description: Leon Panetta, who served as CIA Director and Defense Secretary, says the Ukrainians have a real opportunity right now to push back Russian troops.

title: Donald Trump's most ridiculous claim -- maybe ever
description: To say that Donald Trump has said something outrageous -- and laughable -- is de rigeur at this point.

title: Colorful, 'sporty chic' and iconic: See this year's luxury watch trends
description: CNN spoke to the executives of Jaeger-LeCoultre, IWC Schaffhausen and Chopard about this year's top luxury watch trends at the Watches & Wonders trade show in Geneva, Switzerland.

title: 'The Simpsons' features deaf actor for the first time
description: "The Simpsons" debuts a deaf actor for the first time in its 33-year history. Even though the characters in the show have only four fingers, they'll use American Sign Language in the groundbreaking episode. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

title: Your personality may predict later cognitive decline, study says
description: Certain personality traits may be a key factor in whether people develop mild cognitive impairment later in life, a new study found.

title: Oil prices tumble as economies show strain
description: Oil prices may have met their match — for now, at least.

title: Doubts over Russia's ability to make a breakthrough in the Donbas
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has a new general overseeing his war in Ukraine, and his military commanders are signaling a new phase in the war: an all-out effort to take and hold the portions of Ukraine's Donbas region still under Ukrainian control.

title: Russia struck train station where thousands were hoping to escape war
description: CNN's Ben Wedeman visits the aftermath of a Russian missile strike on a train station in Kramatorsk, eastern Ukraine, being used by civilians trying to flee the fighting. Ukrainian officials say the attack left at least 50 people, including five children, dead.

title: War could destroy nearly half of Ukraine's economy this year
description: Ukraine could lose almost half of its economy this year as a result of Russia's invasion, according to the World Bank.

title: 'I don't even want to think about the championship fight at the moment': Max Verstappen on his second retirement in three races
description: Defending Formula One world champion Max Verstappen suffered his second retirement in three races, while he watched title rival Charles Leclerc win yet again in dominant fashion and extend his lead in the drivers' championship at the Australian Grand Prix.

title: Shanghai's chaotic Covid lockdown puts other Chinese cities on edge
description: As Shanghai's Covid-19 lockdown leaves residents struggling to access food or medical care, citizens elsewhere in China fear similar stringent measures are heading their way -- even as officials seek to assure the public they are well prepared.

title: What jobs crisis? Top Chinese regulator says tech is booming
description: One of the regulators behind China's dramatic crackdown on private enterprise has tried to quell growing concerns about the impact on employment, saying the country's biggest tech companies have added nearly 80,000 jobs since July and are "full of confidence."

title: New study paid Fox viewers to change the channel
description: David Broockman and Joshua Kalla paid Fox viewers to watch CNN for one month, and then asked them a series of questions about world news. Those answers we complied into a newly released study. Broockman and Kalla share their findings with CNN's Brian Stelter.

title: Novak Djokovic says he's ready to move on after 'mentally and emotionally challenging' start to the year
description: World No. 1 Novak Djokovic has said he is ready to put a difficult start to the year behind him as he prepares to kick-off his clay court season at the Monte Carlo Masters this week.

title: Elon Musk will not join Twitter board
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who recently bought a large stake in Twitter, has decided not to join the social media company's board.

title: Ukraine bracing for expected major assault
Manchester City and Liverpool write thrilling new English 'Clasico' chapter in friendliest of rivalries between managers
description: Football rivalries are often difficult to define.

title: Russia has defaulted on its foreign debt, says S&P
description: Russia has defaulted on its foreign debt because it offered bondholders payments in rubles, not dollars, credit ratings agency S&P has said.

title: Biden to announce new gun regulation and name ATF nominee
description: President Joe Biden will announce a new firearm regulation Monday meant to contain the use of privately made weapons, senior administration officials said, as he comes under pressure to take more steps to address gun violence.

title: Scottie Scheffler wins 2022 Masters, the first major of his career, following dominant performance
Leave your shoes outside, these scientists say
description: You probably clean your shoes if you step in something muddy or disgusting. (Please pick up after your dog!) But when you get home, do you always de-shoe at the door?

title: Power has been restored to much of Puerto Rico following an island-wide outage
description: Power could be fully restored in Puerto Rico by Sunday morning after hundreds of thousands of people on the island have been in the dark since a fire at a power plant Wednesday evening, officials said.

title: The West plans to increase its military aid to Ukraine with Russia planning its next big assault
description: Western leaders are grappling with how far to escalate their military aid to Ukraine as the Russian invasion seems headed for a brutal new turn, a decision that may rest on whether the West's goal is to push for a total defeat of President Vladimir Putin.

title: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan ousted as country's leader following vote of no-confidence
description: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan has been ousted as the country's leader following a vote of no-confidence over allegations of economic mismanagement, bringing an end to his tumultuous term in office.

title: Traveler told TSA he had 'no idea' a sword was concealed in his cane
description: Someone isn't getting through security.
